title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
Hello ,

I got this Macbook A1989  was previously water damaged and was repaired by me , last week the owner brought it saying that its not charging and not booting  , so I have checked it and on my AMP meter i am getting 5.09V      , 1.01 watts and 0.20 amps . So I proceeded to open it and take a quick look inside and all was looking fine .So I pulled out the board and connect my amp meter and placed the board under my thermal imager and found that U6903 was getting super hot , so I ordered U6903 on eBay since i did not have any donor boards here to harvest it from , I received the chip on Friday and I installed it Yesterday and the behavior did not change . Since after I changed U6903 with the new chip that I ordered U7800 and U3900 The T2 along with U6903 they get hot but still no 20V on my USB amp meter and no boot , I have checked all  the CD3215 Chips  and I have even changed the whole 4 of them which  I did not even have to but did it just in case , now I m wondering if my U6903 new chip can be bad as the seller would allow only one chip per order so i was able to get only one chip of U6903 . PPBUS_G3H is Present.

Please Help me out.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
Changing a chip because geting hot???
Usually heats because of overcurrent, caused by OTHER component.

Didn't even check its output voltage?
What about diode mode to ground at 3V3_G3H_RTC?

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: I forgot to mention that , That was the first thing that I did ,  3V3_G3H_RTC before I removed  the chip was short to ground Diode mode was . then as soon as I remove the chip the short was gone then after I replace the new chip  3V3_G3H_RTC  in diode mode was 0.311    and  measuring 3V3_G3H_RTC voltage i am getting 12.28

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
12.28V on 3V3_G3H_RTC for sure???
The board must be trash in such case.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
I have another good board the same type also when i measured  3V3_G3H_RTC   I am getting 12.65V, I wonder if my new U6903  that I ordered on eBay is working. Any other suggestions? 

Thank you very much.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
No idea how can you get such voltage on 3V3_G3H_RTC.
Did you really check on correct point?
What about L6900/01 voltage?

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
I was also shocked too  as i was expecting 3.3v there  and that was why I got my known good board to compare voltages and the good working one was giving me 12.65V  

L6900 and 6901 is giving me 3.373V

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
P3V3G3HRTC_FB  = 0.869V

P3V3G3HRTC_SS  = 0.869V

I am going to rerun the voltages again , but I am having a very strong feeling that my U6903 that i got from Ebay maybe is not a genuine chip , I don't wanna pull it from my other good working board as I keep them to compare voltages when they come in with problem , On rossmangroup store t U6903 is not listed , do you have any other suppliers where i can get those from and Quick?

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
"L6900 and 6901 is giving me 3.373V"
What's the problem then, why do you want to change U6903 again???
Isn't 3V3_G3H_RTC coming from these coils?
I cannot understand how do you got 12V before...

PLEASE, try to understand a schematic and post ACCURATE information.
We can't help if your replies are "out of range"...

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
Ok , Sorry If I did not clearly express that  but  3V3_G3H_RTC and PP3V3_G3H_RTC_REG_R to me they are two different power rails from my point of view ,

And I can see  L6900 and 6901  is connected to the power rail   PP3V3_G3H_RTC_REG_R is providing 3.373V  , but  the 12.28V that I mentioned in  my earlier message  is  coming from PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3HRTC_R . I am going to post of the diode mode and voltages of U6903

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
Don't bother anymore with U6903 if you indeed get correct 3V3_G3H_RTC.

All AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages present?
Check LDO voltages for CD3215 chips.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: Ok, let me get that.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: Ok, let me check that.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
All AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages is present and normal

When I Check LDO voltages for CD3215 chips.  I found U3100  , 3200, as well as UB300  PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC  0.000,    without voltages while all the other voltages are present , that same   PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC diode mode reading is 0.486  However at UB400  PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC is present and normal , Help me to proceed please.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: I forgot to mention that  All the 4 CD3215 chps  Have been replaced by new ones .

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
1V1 LDO appears only on the powered port!
Check it again.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: Is U3200 the power port Or UB400? Cause I only  get 1v1 at UB400 please advice.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
With power port I mean USB-C connector.
Each CD3215 chip corresponds to a different power port...

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: Understood, I am getting 1v1 at UB400 and all the other LDO Voltages are normal, but i am still stuck at  5.09V on my USB amp Meter.

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: Did you check if any other CD3215 chip gets corresponding 1V1 LDO, when connect charger on its port?

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: All the other ones are giving me 0.000  only UB400 Giving me the correct 1V1

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message:
Then you have a problem on USB-C areas related with the other chips.
Compare diode mode readings around these with UB400.

I hope UB400 doesn't get 1V1 LDO when you connect charger to another port...

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: That Macbook got wet very badly ,  It seems to be a layer issue, cause i can feel when i place the probe to run test around the area of U3200  if i press the area,  around  feels like a sponge like its bouncing back and forth , I think that i will just hand it back to the customer. I have fixed a good bit of those with that same issue and never had to face that kinda issue before .

title: Macbook A1989 820-00850-A  No boot
message: UB400 doesn't get 1V1 LDO when you connect charger to another port
